metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 26 axioms covering expectations, justifications, expectation management, and confirmation/violation
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities and temporal reasoning

axioms.title: Definition of expect
axioms.fol: (forall (e0 a e t1 t0) (iff (expect' e0 a e t1 t0) (exists (e1 e2) (and (atTime' e1 e t1)(believe' e2 a e1) (atTime e2 t0)(before t0 t1)(gen e2 e0)))))
axioms.english: e0 is the eventuality of agent a, at time t0, expecting that e will happen or hold at time t1. The belief e2 that e will happen or hold at t1 constitutes the expectation

axioms.title: Definition of unexpect
axioms.fol: (forall (a e t1 t0) (iff (unexpect a e t1 t0) (exists (e1 e2) (and (atTime' e1 e t1)(believe' e2 a e1) (not (atTime e2 t0))))))
axioms.english: It is possible to fail to believe some event will occur at some future time - unexpect means this

axioms.title: Definition of expectationJustification
axioms.fol: (forall (s a e t1 t0) (iff (expectationJustification s a e t1 t0) (exists (e0 e1 s1 e2) (and (expect' e0 a e t1 t0)(cwu0' e1 s a t0) (eventualitiesOf s1 s)(atTime' e2 e t1) (member e2 s1)(cause e1 e0)))))
axioms.english: Agent a's current world understanding s at time t0 includes e being true at time t1. The fact e1 that s is the current world understanding causes the expectation e0

axioms.title: Definition of addExpectation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e t1) (iff (addExpectation a e t1 t0) (exists (s0 s1 e0 e1 t2) (and (ecs' e0 s0 a)(ecs' e1 s1 a) (not (expectationJustification s0 a e t1 t2)) (expectationJustification s1 a e t1 t0) (change e0 e1)))))
axioms.english: To add a justified expectation e is to extend an envisioned causal system to the point where e is predicted

axioms.title: Definition of removeExpectation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e t1) (iff (removeExpectation a e t1 t0) (exists (s0 s1 e0 e1 t2) (and (ecs' e0 s0 a)(ecs' e1 s1 a) (expectationJustification s0 a e t1 t2) (not (expectationJustification s1 a e t1 t0)) (change e0 e1)))))
axioms.english: To remove a justified expectation is just the opposite - move from having justification to not having justification

axioms.title: Person ability to add expectations
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (e0 c e t1 t0) (and (able a e0 c)(addExpectation' e0 a e t1 t0)))))
axioms.english: People have an ability to add expectations

axioms.title: Person ability to remove expectations
axioms.fol: (forall (a) (if (person a) (exists (e0 c e t1 t0) (and (able a e0 c)(removeExpectation' e0 a e t1 t0)))))
axioms.english: People have an ability to remove expectations

axioms.title: Definition of expectationConfirmation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e t1) (iff (expectationConfirmation a e t1) (exists (t0) (and (expect a e t1 t0)(atTime e t1)))))
axioms.english: When the future time of an expectation arrives, the expectation is confirmed if the expected event actually occurs at that time

axioms.title: Definition of expectationViolation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e t1) (iff (expectationViolation a e t1) (exists (t0) (and (expect a e t1 t0)(not (atTime e t1))))))
axioms.english: When the future time of an expectation arrives, the expectation is violated if the expected event does not occur at that time

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Extensive use of primed predicates for temporal and cognitive processes: expect', atTime', believe', cwu0', ecs', addExpectation', removeExpectation'
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: No axioms use (etc) conditions - this chapter focuses on precise temporal and belief relationships rather than defeasible reasoning
conversion_notes.temporal_complexity: Heavy emphasis on temporal reasoning with before relations, time anchoring, and future-directed beliefs
conversion_notes.cross_references: References Chapter 24 (ecs, cwu0, change), Chapter 21 (believe), temporal framework from earlier chapters
conversion_notes.technical_complexity: Sophisticated temporal logic integrating belief states, causal systems, and expectation management processes

file_format_notes.axiom_extraction: All 9 axioms successfully extracted with proper FOL syntax
file_format_notes.complexity_classification: Based on temporal complexity, quantifier depth, and integration with causal systems
file_format_notes.pattern_recognition: Primarily definitional framework (7/9) with basic existence claims for agent abilities
file_format_notes.reification_detection: Systematic identification of primed predicates for temporal and expectation processes
